title: US postal service issues election warning: Some votes might not be counted
description: • Obama slams Trump for trying to 'kneecap' postal service

title: Barcelona dropped from Champions League in historic loss
description: Bayern Munich scored eight times against Barcelona to help the German side inflict a record defeat on the Catalans to advance to the Champions League semifinals, winning 8-2.

title: Fauci's grave warning about herd immunity
description: If the United States allowed coronavirus infections to run rampant to achieve possible herd immunity, the death toll would be massive, especially among vulnerable people, the nation's top infectious doctor said.

title: US hospitals 'scrambling' after Trump admin's 'abrupt' change to Covid-19 data reporting requirements
Greenland's ice sheet has melted to point of no return
description: Greenland's ice sheet has melted to a point of no return, and efforts to slow global warming will not stop it from disintegrating. That's according to a new study by researchers at Ohio State University.

title: Family evacuated from Wuhan compares China and US virus responses
description: A Tennessee family evacuated from Wuhan, China, as the coronavirus pandemic exploded around the world say the difference between the way the US and China handled the virus is "night and day." CNN's Brianna Keilar reports.

title: Trump offers the illusion of a Middle East peace deal
description: This is not THE Middle East peace deal that has beguiled a generation of American presidents, the one President Donald Trump commissioned his son-in-law and special advisor Jared Kushner to conclude.

title: Marge Simpson responds to Trump adviser's Kamala Harris comparison
description: Doh! Politics have really gotten serious when a beloved but fictional animated character feels compelled to defend herself against a real-world slight.

title: Dolly Parton makes her feelings known on Black Lives Matter
description: Country singer Dolly Parton is making it clear that she supports the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: Gates-backed vaccine maker soars in Wall Street debut
description: The race for a successful coronavirus vaccine is heating up in labs around the world — and on Wall Street. Germany's CureVac, a biotech with the backing of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, more than tripled in its first day of trading Friday.

title: Donald Trump's brother Robert hospitalized in New York, White House says
description: Robert Trump, the younger brother of President Donald Trump, is hospitalized in New York, the White House confirmed Friday.

title: US disrupts millions of barrels of Iranian fuel shipment
description: A multimillion-dollar fuel shipment from a designated foreign terrorist organization in Iran to Venezuela was disrupted by the Justice Department, according to a Friday news release.

title: Fishermen rescue paddleboarders missing at sea for 15 hours
description: A fisherman and his son have been praised for saving the lives of two young paddleboarders who were found clinging to a lobster pot after going missing off the west coast of Ireland for 15 hours.

title: RZA came up with a new ice cream truck jingle because the old one was used in minstrel shows
description: The ice cream truck jingle of your childhood is about to get an upgrade -- and RZA is behind it.

title: Belarus riot police drop shields and are embraced by anti-government protesters
description: At least 50 Belarus security personnel in riot gear dropped their shields and were embraced by anti-government protesters in Minsk, as demonstrators chanted "brothers" at the police.

title: Famed Indian film singer on life support in ICU
description: One of India's most renowned film singers, SP Balasubrahmanyam, is on life support following hospitalization for Covid-19, the hospital treating him said in a bulletin Friday.

title: Resident: Why should we leave Beirut to crooks and thieves?
description: Reports of the demise of Beirut are greatly exaggerated. This year has brought economic devastation, the coronavirus pandemic, civil unrest, political instability and a blast many residents liken to the bombing of Hiroshima. Yet residents tell CNN's Ben Wedeman they, and their city, will rise again.

title: Trump's birtherism attack on Harris is killing the Republican Party
Tokyo has a drive-in haunted house. And it's terrifying
description: We can all agree that screaming is a pivotal part of a great haunted house experience.

title: Michael Jordan's game-worn sneakers set new record
description: A pair of Nikes worn by Michael Jordan has broken the record for the most expensive sneakers ever sold at auction, fetching $615,000.

title: Chrissy Teigen unveils baby bump
description: Supermodel Chrissy Teigen displayed her baby bump in a social media post, confirming that she's expecting her third child with John Legend.

title: Take a look inside Tokyo's drive-in haunted house
description: A Japanese performance group has created an experience that follows social distancing guidelines yet remains absolutely terrifying -- a drive-in haunted house.

title: An ancient Jewish tradition goes virtual
description: For decades, Teme Ring was cut off from her Jewish faith.

title: The secret of Birkenstock's enduring success
description: Pandemic restrictions have meant one thing for most wardrobes: comfort. As many of us continue to work from home -- and staying safe with a trip to the park remains the height of summer's social calendar -- sensible flat sandals are now more pervasive than ever.

title: Fishermen rescue women stuck at sea for 15 hours
description: Two young women survived 15 hours at sea after going missing while paddle boarding in Galway, Ireland. They were found the next day clinging to a lobster pot buoy by a local father and son fishermen duo. CNN affiliate Virgin Media News has the story.

title: Kelly Clarkson takes on Twitter troll
description: Kelly Clarkson took on a social media follower who trolled her about her divorce from ex-husband, Brandon Blackstock.

title: Media tycoon says 'the fight has to go on' in Hong Kong after 'symbolic' arrest under new law
Dennis Quaid, the actor, adopts Dennis Quaid, the cat
description: Hollywood actor Dennis Quaid has a furry new friend -- a cute black rescue cat. Its name? Dennis Quaid.

title: 'China's Netflix' is being investigated by the SEC for alleged fraud
description: Investors are getting nervous about iQiyi, the online streaming provider often referred to as the "Netflix of China," as regulators examine allegations of inflated earnings.

title: UK removes France from its list of 'safe' destinations
description: The UK has reimposed a 14-day quarantine on all arrivals from France after the country recorded a sharp rise in Covid-19 cases.

title: We landed dream jobs as caretakers of an Irish island -- then Covid struck
description: It was Valentine's Day this year that Dublin couple Annie Birney and Eoin Boyle found out they'd landed what might just be the world's most romantic job.

title: How 11-year-old Gui Khury made skateboarding history with first 1080 on a vertical ramp
description: Even before he was born, Gui Khury owned a skateboard, and even before he could walk, Khury was learning to skate.

title: Shanghai Pride shuts down amid shrinking space for LGBTQ community
description: Shanghai Pride, China's longest-running and only major annual celebration of sexual minorities, abruptly announced its effective shutdown on Thursday, in the latest sign of the authorities' increasing clampdown on civil society and LGBTQ rights in the country.

title: Neighbor shot and killed 5-year-old as he played outside, police say
description: Police have charged a 25-year-old man with first-degree murder after they say he shot and killed a 5-year-old boy last week in Wilson, North Carolina.

title: Hailstorm of 'icy ping pong balls' pelts cyclists during race
description: The second stage of cycling's Critérium du Dauphiné ended in chaos as riders were pelted by large hailstones.

title: Why it's important to remember that Andy Warhol was working class
description: Beyond the downtown glamour associated with the artist and his famous friends, Warhol's working-class roots had a profound influence on his art. This rarely considered aspect of his life  is explored in an exhibition at Tate Modern in London.

title: New Zealand imposes 12-day lockdown in its biggest city as it battles fresh outbreak
description: New Zealand has extended a lockdown in its most populous city as the country battles a fresh community coronavirus outbreak that comes after months without any locally transmitted cases.

title: Europe's summer tourist season may be officially past saving
description: Europe's summer tourist season may be officially past saving.

title: Belarusians accuse authorities of torture and humiliation during mass detentions
description: Several people who were detained for participating in mass protests in Belarus this week allege that the country's security forces beat, tortured and humiliated them while in government custody.

title: Hospitals 'scrambling' after Trump administration's 'abrupt' change to  Covid-19 data reporting requirements
description: In a letter, public health advisers to the US government said they are "extremely concerned" and "troubled" by the Trump administration's decision to change how hospitals report Covid-19 data.

title: FBI asks for public's help after a Georgia mom mysteriously disappears in Florida
description: The FBI is asking the public's help in locating a missing Georgia mom whose son was found wandering barefoot in Florida last month.

title: Hear why Super Bowl champ is opting out of NFL season
description: Damien Williams, running back for the Super Bowl Champion Kansas City Chiefs, is opting out of the 2020 NFL season. Williams' mother is fighting stage four cancer, and he is concerned that he might expose her to Covid-19 if he were to play.

title: New US sanctions could slowly strangle Huawei's smartphone business
description: Huawei recently became the world's biggest smartphone maker, beating Samsung and Apple at their own game by offering consumers state of the art phones with amazing cameras at competitive prices.

title: Trump's election meddling is threatening US democracy
description: Never mind meddling by Russia, China or Iran. The most dangerous threat to the integrity of November's election is coming from the man sworn to protect it, the President of the United States.

title: Police officer ordered his K9 to bite a Black man's leg repeatedly, lawyers say
description: A man's leg may need to be amputated after the Salt Lake City Police Department allegedly used excessive force against him by ordering a police dog to bite the man repeatedly, leaving him severely injured.

title: Harris throws Trump off balance
description:
• Judge orders Trump campaign to produce evidence of voter fraud
• Analysis: Trump's election meddling is threatening US democracy
• Harris' diverse family heritage

title: Don Lemon: Guess how many of Harris' GOP colleagues stood up for her?
description: After President Trump floated a baseless birther theory about Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA), CNN's Don Lemon said his producers reached out to all 53 of Harris' GOP colleagues in the Senate for comment.

title: Pentagon to launch task force to investigate UFO sightings
description: The Pentagon is forming a new task force to investigate UFOs that have been observed by US military aircraft, according to two defense officials.

title: This startup wants to turn Dubai's desert into farmland
description: At the beginning of March, a team traveled to Dubai and planted watermelon, zucchini and pearl millet in a plot of desert.

title: Postal Service removes some mail-sorting machines, sparking concerns ahead of election
description: The US Postal Service plans to remove hundreds of high-volume mail-processing machines from facilities across the country, leading some postal workers to fear they may have less capacity to process mail during election season.

title: Bernie Sanders: Trump is crazy, not stupid
description: In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper, Sen. Bernie Sanders (D-VT) said President Donald Trump is "crazy, not stupid" when it comes to the plan he told Fox Business about in an interview to withhold funds for USPS over mail-in ballots.
